posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.26 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here .

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No user-facing changes

Complete list of new commits since 7.25.2
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.25.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

While there’s no UX-related changes, there have been some changes to how we derive some keys. Please keep an eye out to make sure settings and actions are syncing appropriately across your linked devices. Things like muting chats, marking them unread, stuff like that. Thank you!
Link to the previous v7.25 beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.25 release - #19 by Whatnoww

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.25 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.26.0 (148800)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

40 new commits since 7.25.2:

Show commits

  • Remove old donation jobs. [1]

  • Update libsignal-net integration to match libsignal v0.62.0. [2]

  • Add MediaTTL to subscriptions configuration and wire in. [3]

  • Normalize receipt labeling. [4]

  • Add a .tool-versions to indicate which version of java should be used. [5]

  • Add backup specific strings for token redemption error. [6]

  • Add copy for paid-tier-pending dialog. [7]

  • Update to actions/upload-artifact v4. [8]

  • Include unregistered users in blocked sync message. [9]

  • Detect storage space issues during restore. [10]

  • Hardcode auto-provisioning in Gradle to off. [11]

  • Fix restore/transfer string typos. [12]

  • Resolve some gradle 8 deprecations. [13]

    Resolves #13788

  • Remove unreachable dependencies from verification-metadata.xml [14]

    I did this by clearing the components entries:
    perl -i -0777 -pe 's/<components>.*?</components>//gs' gradle/verification-metadata.xml
    And then regenerating them:
    ./gradlew --write-verification-metadata sha256 qa --rerun-tasks
    Resolves #13791

  • Convert some Java tests to Kotlin. [15]

    Resolves #13792

  • Switch to using toml version catalogs. [16]

    Resolves #13792

  • Prevent displaying AppSettings content until self is non-null. [17]

  • Display proper error when call link deletion fails due to call link being in use. [18]

  • Convert InternalValues to kotlin. [19]

  • Implement checkin job for backups. [20]

  • Change the JobDatabase to use a different error handler. [21]

    Relates to #13762

  • Remove redundant zkcCredential=true [22]

  • Add deletion method to ArchiveApi. [23]

  • Sync the MediaRootBackupKey during linking. [24]

  • Fix link+sync uploads. [25]

  • Update link+sync ui. [26]

  • Remove mockito usage from android tests. [27]

  • Rotate the link+sync flag. [28]

  • Update bug_report.yaml [29]

    Resolves #13803

  • Remove junit.framework [30]

    Resolves #13805

  • Remove BaseUnitTest.java [31]

    Resolves #13804

  • Make LibSignalChatConnection Only Use Each ChatService Once [32]

  • Introduce AEP and SSRE2. [33]

  • Added a Storage Service Playground screen. [34]

  • Update backup string (digit -> character). [35]

  • Utilize fixed test address for mockwebserver. [36]

  • Improve error reporting in storage service playground. [37]

  • Allow stories to be embedded with link previews that do not have titles. [38]

  • Update translations and other static files. [39]

  • Bump version to 7.26.0 [40]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.25.2…v7.26.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.cooked:
Hey Gresyon. Thank you very much for the hasLinkedDevice state work
There’s just one last thing, is it intentional that there are two states as of 7.26? One in AccountValues.kt, the other in MiscellaneousValues.kt

github.com

signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/f2c3713ae3942268937e3327c10005471082f10b/app/src/main/java/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/keyvalue/AccountValues.kt#L494


      
    
          
  1.   val self = Recipient.self()
    2. 
          
  2. 
          
  3.   SignalDatabase.recipients.setProfileKey(self.id, newProfileKey)
    4. 
          
  4.   AppDependencies.groupsV2Authorization.clear()
    5. 
          
  5. }
    6. 
          
  6. 
          
  7. /**
    8. 
          
  8.  * Whether or not the user has linked devices.
    9. 
          
  9.  */
    10. 
          
  10. @get:JvmName("hasLinkedDevices")
    11. 
          
  11. var hasLinkedDevices by booleanValue(KEY_HAS_LINKED_DEVICES, false)
    12. 
          
  12. 
          
  13. /** Do not alter. If you need to migrate more stuff, create a new method. */
    14. 
          
  14. private fun migrateFromSharedPrefsV1(context: Context) {
    15. 
          
  15.   Log.i(TAG, "[V1] Migrating account values from shared prefs.")
    16. 
          
  16. 
          
  17.   putString(KEY_ACI, TextSecurePreferences.getStringPreference(context, "pref_local_uuid", null))
    18. 
          
  18.   putString(KEY_E164, TextSecurePreferences.getStringPreference(context, "pref_local_number", null))
    19. 
          
  19.   putString(KEY_SERVICE_PASSWORD, TextSecurePreferences.getStringPreference(context, "pref_gcm_password", null))
    20. 
          
  20.   putBoolean(KEY_IS_REGISTERED, TextSecurePreferences.getBooleanPreference(context, "pref_gcm_registered", false))
    21. 
          
  21.   putInteger(KEY_REGISTRATION_ID, TextSecurePreferences.getIntegerPreference(context, "pref_local_registration_id", 0))
    22.
github.com

signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/f2c3713ae3942268937e3327c10005471082f10b/app/src/main/java/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/keyvalue/MiscellaneousValues.kt#L168


      
    
          
  1. 
          
  2. /**
    3. 
          
  3.  * Whether or not we've done the initial "PNP Hello World" dance.
    4. 
          
  4.  */
    5. 
          
  5. var hasPniInitializedDevices by booleanValue(PNI_INITIALIZED_DEVICES, true)
    6. 
          
  6. 
          
  7. /**
    8. 
          
  8.  * Whether or not the user has linked devices.
    9. 
          
  9.  */
    10. 
          
  10. @get:JvmName("hasLinkedDevices")
    11. 
          
  11. var hasLinkedDevices by booleanValue(HAS_LINKED_DEVICES, false)
    12. 
          
  12. 
          
  13. /**
    14. 
          
  14.  * Whether or not we should show a reminder for the user to relink their devices after re-registering.
    15. 
          
  15.  */
    16. 
          
  16. var shouldShowLinkedDevicesReminder by booleanValue(LINKED_DEVICES_REMINDER, false)
    17. 
          
  17. 
          
  18. /**
    19. 
          
  19.  * The color the user saved for rendering their shareable username QR code.
    20. 
          
  20.  */
    21. 
          
  21. var usernameQrCodeColorScheme: UsernameQrCodeColorScheme
    22.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Dependency verification failed for configuration ‘:Signal-Android:detachedConfiguration2’
One artifact failed verification: aapt2-8.4.1-11315950-windows.jar (com.android.tools.build:aapt2:8.4.1-11315950) from repository Google

I believe it’s missing in validation files?

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Yes, the windows version is missing (again). You can just copy it from 7.25.2 that uses the same value into verification-metadata.xml.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
a message fron three days ago was never sent.

as it was never sent i can’t grab a timestamp, but it was 2024-11-19, at 16:17 local time UTC+1.
the app has since been stopped (once forcefully and thrice by an update) and it did not help.

logs

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.26.0/197b73a1924b0a91e0f89b9aac5c118f2098616ccb71020de4a0cdee4ac375cf
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.25.2/1ff2a0dbf06c98ee296eec69a69780a9c58b2686b07f6fad84352bfeb49861f0
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.25.0/f7b82085d7492564105560ef44f25079074c2ab0ded49be0e58bdeade8f365f0

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: A post was merged into an existing topic: What’s your most-missed-feature-ranking?

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
tony10:

is it intentional that there are two states as of 7.26

nope Thank you for pointing it out!

Whatnoww:

I believe it’s missing in validation files?

*sigh* I wish there was a better way to force it to get all of the various OS-specific hashes. If anyone knows of an easy way, let me know

rassilon1963:

a message fron three days ago was never sent.

Huh, so I see no message jobs pending, and no job that was created around that time… That leads me to believe that the bug is that we never actually enqueued a send job. From a practical standpoint, that means you should delete it and resend it if the message is important. And from my end, we’ll try to figure out how that happened. Thank you!

New Version: 7.26.1 (148900)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

6 new commits since 7.26.0:

  • Update libphonenumber to 8.13.50 [1]

  • Import correct InvalidKeyException in LinkDeviceRepository. [2]

    Resolves #13808

  • Use the correct link device flag. [3]

  • Add support for the new Benin phone format. [4]

  • Update translations and other static files. [5]

  • Bump version to 7.26.1 [6]

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

you should delete it and resend it if the message is important

yeah thankfully it wasn’t, as i only realised it wasn’t sending a few hours after first sending it. but at least we got some debugging out of that, so that probably cancels out.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Something odd happened, after I upgraded Signal Android to 7.26.0 I suddenly had all the spammer groups from 2 years ago back in Signal desktop. I had to delete them all manually, both in stable and beta, it didn’t sync. I didn’t see any of it in Signal Android or linked Molly’s.

Sorry, I was so that I forgot to make a debug log.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: i mean you can still make one now

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
anon53652:

suddenly had all the spammer groups from 2 years ago back in Signal desktop

Getting logs from both devices would be helpful, particularly desktop.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
If that is still usefull:

Desktop production: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.34.0/03198c14887167d8a5268db6aaead6d6d2e02ef596ed1fc96d9f1936a24b5d52.gz

Desktop beta: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.35.0-beta.1/cf3dc86a01311766edb3cedc0de5460202d6bff90b28fbc985fc87c15443a796.gz

Android: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.26.0-JW/7e2fcfb258e59efa1dc4c472b684bbb25149e71a4682fb0a9d4752df2535801d

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

I wish there was a better way to force it to get all of the various OS-specific hashes.

Sorry, I don’t know. But it’s still missing the windows version in 7.26.1.

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
Calls don’t turn off the screen while holding the phone near the ear.

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.25 release Android Beta Feedback
Calls aren’t disabling the screen, even though the proximity sensor is completely functional in other apps. Very annoying. This has been happening for the last releases. Can you take a look into this, please? https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.2/2fb39163c113fb14f799b51c711d90fe420ccc06fd8e9093a669e1c5ded2bd52

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.25 release

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
Same problem exists with voice messages.

Why do old bugs keep resurfacing?

There’s no need to re-report the same bug in every beta. They’re not necessarily resurfacing. This one was reported a day before the last beta finished. This one probably wasn’t fixed yet. Reporting them doesn’t automatically put them at the top of the list.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
sigfun:

Same problem exists with voice messages.

I can repro, we’ll take a look.
